NewEndSequence(String, String, String)

Another convenience function to generate an "end" sequence where the user must hit close (e.g. a dialog end). This is useful to make a jumpable end to a previous dialog option.

Declaration
public HybrasylDialogSequence NewEndSequence(string simpleDialog, string callback = "", string name = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String simpleDialog

The text of the simple dialog.
System.String callback

An optional Lua callback expression that will be attached to the simple dialog.
System.String name

An optional name to give the dialog sequence.
Returns
Type Description
HybrasylDialogSequence

The constructed dialog sequence
| Improve this Doc View Source

NewFunctionDialog(String)

Create a function dialog, which is an "invisible" dialog that will execute a Lua expression when shown to the player. The dialog function will be run, and then the next dialog in the sequence will be shown to the player.

Declaration
public HybrasylDialog NewFunctionDialog(string luaExpr)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String luaExpr

The lua expression to run when the FunctionDialog is evaluated
Returns
Type Description
HybrasylDialog

The constructed dialog
| Improve this Doc View Source

NewJumpDialog(String, String)

Create a jump dialog, which is an "invisible" dialog that is used to start a new sequence from a subdialog. Can be used to jump between different NPC dialogue branches.

Declaration
public HybrasylDialog NewJumpDialog(string targetSequence, string callbackExpression = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String targetSequence

The name of the sequence that will start when this JumpDialog is "shown" to the player.
System.String callbackExpression

A lua expression that will run when this dialog is shown to the player.
Returns
Type Description
HybrasylDialog

The constructed dialog
| Improve this Doc View Source

NewOptionsDialog(String, HybrasylDialogOptions, String, String)

Create a new options dialog (a dialog that displays clickable options to the player).

Declaration
public HybrasylDialog NewOptionsDialog(string displayText, HybrasylDialogOptions dialogOptions, string callback = "", string handler = "")
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String displayText

The text to be displayed in the dialog
HybrasylDialogOptions dialogOptions

A collection of dialog options (eg HybrasylDialogOptions) associated with this dialog
System.String callback

A callback function or expression that will fire when this dialog is shown to a player
System.String handler

A callback function or expression that will handle the response once a player selects (clicks) an option
Returns
Type Description

NewTextAndJumpDialog(String, String, String, String)

Create a new dialog sequence consisting of a simple dialog and a jump to a new sequence. Useful for a lot of dialogs where you need to display one dialog and go back to the main menu.

Declaration
public HybrasylDialogSequence NewTextAndJumpDialog(string simpleDialog, string jumpTarget, string callback = "", string name = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String simpleDialog

Text for the simple dialog.
System.String jumpTarget

The new sequence to start after the user hits next on the simple dialog.
System.String callback

An optional Lua callback expression that will be attached to the simple dialog.
System.String name

An optional name to give the dialog sequence.
Returns
Type Description
HybrasylDialogSequence

The constructed dialog sequence
| Improve this Doc View Source

NewTextDialog(String, String, String, Int32, String, String)

Create a new text dialog (a dialog that asks a player a question; the player can type in a response).

Declaration
public HybrasylDialog NewTextDialog(string displayText, string topCaption, string bottomCaption, int inputLength = 254, string callback = "", string handler = "")
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String displayText

The text to be displayed in the dialog
System.String topCaption

The top caption of the text box input
System.String bottomCaption

The bottom caption of the text box input
System.Int32 inputLength

The maximum length (up to 254 characters) of the text that can be typed into the dialog by the player
System.String callback

The callback function or lua expression that will fire when this dialog is shown to a player.
System.String handler

The function or lua expression that will handle the response once the player hits enter / hits next.
Returns
Type Description
HybrasylDialog

The constructed dialog
